tn.text: "In the time of Ahasuerus" or "When Ahasuerus was ruling as king"

tn.ref: this is Ahasuerus who reigned from India as far as Ethiopia, over 127 provinces
tn.text: This is background information to help the reader identify Ahasuerus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
"one hundred and twenty seven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
A "province" is a large area into which some countries are divided for the purposes of government.
Here "royal throne" may refer to his rule over the kingdom. AT: "ruled the empire" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
A castle, stronghold or fortified city.
A royal city of Persian Kings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: In the third year of his reign
tn.text: "After he had ruled for 2 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This may refer to the leaders of the army. AT: The officers of the army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: the wealth of the splendor of his kingdom
tn.text: These words have similar meaning and emphasize how great his kingdom was. AT: "the great wealth of his kingdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: the honor of the glory of his greatness
tn.text: These words have similar meaning and emphasize how great he was. AT: "the splendor of his greatness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"one hundred and eighty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"At the end of that feast"
This was a second feast that was only for the officials in Susa. AT: "another feast that lasted seven days"
"7" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:1]].
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
A "mosaic" consists of colored stones arranged in an attractive pattern.
This is a kind of red and purple rock that contained pieces of crystal.

tn.ref: Drinks were served in golden cups
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The guests drank wine from gold cups" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: there was much royal wine that came because of the king's generosity
tn.text: "the king was very generous with the royal wine"
"great willingness to give"
"No one must be forced to drink"

tn.ref: The king had given orders to all the staff of his palace to do for them whatever each guest desired
tn.text: This statement means that the king told his workers to give all the guests as much wine as they wanted.
"After 6 days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: the king's heart was feeling happy because of the wine
tn.text: Here "heart" refers to the king, and "feeling happy" is an idiom that means he was drunk. AT: "the king was drunk with wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcas
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the seven officials who served before him
tn.text: This is background information to explain who these men were. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
"she was very beautiful"

tn.ref: at the word of the king that had been brought to her by the officials
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when the king's officials told her about his command" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "word" refers to the entire command. AT: "at the command" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The intensity of the king's anger is spoken of as if it was a fire that burned inside him. AT: "his rage was as intense as a fire inside him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"who understood the things that happened in their lives"

tn.ref: for this was the king's procedure toward all who were expert in law and judgment
tn.text: This background information explains why the king called these men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

tn.ref: Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan
tn.text: These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"7" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: "In compliance with the law ... by the officials?"
tn.text: It may be helpful to state who asked this question. AT: "The king said to them, 'In compliance with the law ... by the officials?'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"In observance of the law" or "In obedience to the law"
Translate his name as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:13|1:14]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: all the officials and all the people ... all the provinces ... all women
tn.text: These are exaggerations to emphasize the damage that the queens refusal caused. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:1]].

tn.ref: There will be much contempt and anger
tn.text: "They will be angry with their husbands and treat them with contempt"
Memucan continues to answer the king.

tn.ref: If it pleases the king ... from him ... before him ... Let the king ... the king's decree ... his vast kingdom
tn.text: Memucan speaks to the king in third person as a form of respect. AT: If it pleases your Majesty ... from you ... before you ... Please ... your decree ... your vast kingdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which no one can change" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: When the king's decree is proclaimed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When they hear the king's decree" or "when they hear what you haver commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"big" or "huge"

tn.ref: from the greatest to the least significant
tn.text: This is a merism that refers to both extremes and everyone in between. This probably refers to the husbands, but it is possible that it refers to the wives. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
Translate his name as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:13|1:14]].(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:1]].

tn.ref: every man should be master of his own household
tn.text: "all men should have complete authority over their wives and their children" (UDB)
This can be stated in active form. AT: "They write this decree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
